intro: Ornithogalum boucheanum, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a bulbous plant native to South Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulb, which stores nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum boucheanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
